00027 namespace detail {
00028 
00029 std::vector<int> sieveOfEratosthenes(int upTo) {
00030     std::vector<int> sieve;
00031     sieve.reserve(upTo);
00032 
00033     // Zero and one aren't prime, by definition.
00034     sieve.push_back(0);
00035     sieve.push_back(0);
00036 
00037     for (int p=2; p<upTo; ++p) sieve.push_back(p);
00038 
00039     std::vector<int> ret;
00040 
00041     int *p=&sieve[0], *e=p+upTo;
00042     while (p<e) {
00043         if (*p==0) { ++p; continue; }
00044         ret.push_back(*p);
00045 
00046         int *p2=p+(*p);
00047         while (p2<e) { *p2=0; p2+=*p; }
00048 
00049         ++p;
00050     }
00051 
00052     return ret;
00053 }
00054 
00055 // The Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00056 int isProbablePrimeBaseB(const integer& n, const integer &b, callback_t
00057     callback)
00058 {
00059     const integer nMinus1(n - integer::one());
00060 
00061     // Find r and a satisfying: n-1=2^a * r, r odd
00062     integer r=nMinus1;
00063     unsigned long a=0;
00064     while (r.even()) { r >>= 1; ++a; }
00065 
00066     // We check the congruence class of b^((2^i)r) % n for each i
00067     // from 0 to a - 1. If any one is correct, then n passes.
00068     // Otherwise, n fails.
00069     integer test=powmod(b, r, n);
00070     if (test==integer::one() || test==nMinus1) return 1; // Better than 3/4 chance it's prime
00071 
00072     while (a-->0) {
00073         test=sqrmod(test, n);
00074         if (test==nMinus1) return 1;
00075     }
00076 
00077     if (callback && !callback()) return -1;
00078     return 0;
00079 }
00080 
00081 } // namespace detail

00106 int is_prime(const integer& n, callback_t callback) {
00107     if (n < 2) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("xint::is_prime cannot test "
00108         "numbers below 2");
00109 
00110     // First we trial-divide it by the primes below 2000
00111     static const std::vector<int> cLowPrimes(detail::sieveOfEratosthenes(2000));
00112     std::vector<int>::const_iterator i=cLowPrimes.begin(), ie=cLowPrimes.end();
00113     for (; i!=ie; ++i) if ((n % *i)==0) return (n==*i);
00114 
00115     // Run the number through the Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00116     // a few times to see if it's actually (probably) prime.
00117     for (int count=0; count<5; ++count) {
00118         unsigned int k=detail::get_random();
00119         int isP=isProbablePrimeBaseB(n, k, callback);
00120         if (isP <= 0) return isP;
00121     }
00122     return 1; // Appears to be prime!
00123 }
00124 
00126 int is_prime(const fixed_integer_any& n, callback_t callback) {
00127     return is_prime(integer(n), callback);
00128 }
00129 
00154 integer random_prime(size_t size_in_bits, callback_t callback) {
00155     if (size_in_bits < 2) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("cannot create "
00156         "prime numbers smaller than two bits");
00157 
00158     // Call the callback for the first time
00159     if (callback && !callback()) return integer::zero();
00160 
00161     integer pe=pow2(size_in_bits+1);
00162     while (1) {
00163         integer p(random_by_size(size_in_bits, true, true));
00164         while (p < pe) {
00165             int r=is_prime(p, callback);
00166             if (r < 0) return integer::zero();
00167             if (r == 1) return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(p);
00168             p+=2;
00169         }
00170     }
00171 }
